verses.verse: <S%H199>Wherefore<s%>, <S%H347>Job<s%>, I pray thee, <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H4405>speeches<s%>, and <S%H238>hearken<s%> to all my <S%H1697>words<s%>.
Behold, now I have <S%H6605>opened<s%> my <S%H6310>mouth<s%>, my <S%H3956>tongue<s%> hath <S%H1696>spoken<s%> in my <S%H2441>mouth<s%>. in my mouth: Heb. in my palate
My <S%H561>words<s%> shall be of the <S%H3476>uprightness<s%> of my <S%H3820>heart<s%>: and my <S%H8193>lips<s%> shall <S%H4448>utter<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%> <S%H1305>clearly<s%>.
The <S%H7307>Spirit<s%> of <S%H410>God<s%> hath <S%H6213>made<s%> me, and the <S%H5397>breath<s%> of the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> hath given me <S%H2421>life<s%>.
If thou <S%H3201>canst<s%> <S%H7725>answer<s%> me, set thy words in <S%H6186>order<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> me, stand <S%H3320>up<s%>.
Behold, I am according to thy <S%H6310>wish<s%> in <S%H410>God's<s%> stead: I also am <S%H7169>formed<s%> out of the <S%H2563>clay<s%>. wish: Heb. mouth formed: Heb. cut
Behold, my <S%H367>terror<s%> shall not make thee <S%H1204>afraid<s%>, neither shall my <S%H405>hand<s%> be <S%H3513>heavy<s%> upon thee.
Surely thou hast <S%H559>spoken<s%> in mine <S%H241>hearing<s%>, and I have <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of thy <S%H4405>words<s%>, saying, hearing: Heb. ears
I am <S%H2134>clean<s%> without <S%H6588>transgression<s%>, I am <S%H2643>innocent<s%>; neither is there <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> in me.
Behold, he <S%H4672>findeth<s%> <S%H8569>occasions<s%> against me, he <S%H2803>counteth<s%> me for his <S%H341>enemy<s%>,
He <S%H7760>putteth<s%> my <S%H7272>feet<s%> in the <S%H5465>stocks<s%>, he <S%H8104>marketh<s%> all my <S%H734>paths<s%>.
Behold, in this thou art not <S%H6663>just<s%>: I will <S%H6030>answer<s%> thee, that <S%H433>God<s%> is <S%H7235>greater<s%> than <S%H582>man<s%>.
Why dost thou <S%H7378>strive<s%> against him? for he giveth not <S%H6030>account<s%> of any of his <S%H1697>matters<s%>. he giveth: Heb. he answereth not
For <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H1696>speaketh<s%> <S%H259>once<s%>, yea <S%H8147>twice<s%>, yet man <S%H7789>perceiveth<s%> it not.

In a <S%H2472>dream<s%>, in a <S%H2384>vision<s%> of the <S%H3915>night<s%>, when <S%H8639>deep<s%> sleep <S%H5307>falleth<s%> upon <S%H582>men<s%>, in <S%H8572>slumberings<s%> upon the <S%H4904>bed<s%>;
Then he <S%H1540>openeth<s%> the <S%H241>ears<s%> of <S%H582>men<s%>, and <S%H2856>sealeth<s%> their <S%H4561>instruction<s%>, he: Heb. he revealeth, or, uncovereth
That he may <S%H5493>withdraw<s%> <S%H120>man<s%> from his <S%H4639>purpose<s%>, and <S%H3680>hide<s%> <S%H1466>pride<s%> from <S%H1397>man<s%>. purpose: Heb. work
He keepeth <S%H2820>back<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> from the <S%H7845>pit<s%>, and his <S%H2416>life<s%> from <S%H5674>perishing<s%> by the <S%H7973>sword<s%>. from perishing: Heb. from passing
He is <S%H3198>chastened<s%> also with <S%H4341>pain<s%> upon his <S%H4904>bed<s%>, and the <S%H7230>multitude<s%> <S%H7379><s%> of his <S%H6106>bones<s%> with <S%H386>strong<s%> pain:
So that his <S%H2416>life<s%> <S%H2092>abhorreth<s%> <S%H3899>bread<s%>, and his <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H8378>dainty<s%> <S%H3978>meat<s%>. dainty: Heb. meat of desire
His <S%H1320>flesh<s%> is consumed <S%H3615>away<s%>, that it cannot be <S%H7210>seen<s%>; and his <S%H6106>bones<s%> that were not <S%H7200>seen<s%> stick <S%H8192>out<s%> <S%H8205><s%>.
Yea, his <S%H5315>soul<s%> draweth <S%H7126>near<s%> unto the <S%H7845>grave<s%>, and his <S%H2416>life<s%> to the <S%H4191>destroyers<s%>.

If <S%H3426>there<s%> be a <S%H4397>messenger<s%> with him, an <S%H3887>interpreter<s%>, <S%H259>one<s%> among a <S%H505>thousand<s%>, to <S%H5046>shew<s%> unto <S%H120>man<s%> his <S%H3476>uprightness<s%>:

Then he is <S%H2603>gracious<s%> unto him, and <S%H559>saith<s%>, <S%H6308>Deliver<s%> him from going <S%H3381>down<s%> to the <S%H7845>pit<s%>: I have <S%H4672>found<s%> a <S%H3724>ransom<s%>. a ransom: or, an atonement
His <S%H1320>flesh<s%> shall be <S%H7375>fresher<s%> than a <S%H5290>child's<s%>: he shall <S%H7725>return<s%> to the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H5934>youth<s%>: a child's: Heb. childhood

He shall <S%H6279>pray<s%> unto <S%H433>God<s%>, and he will be <S%H7521>favourable<s%> unto him: and he shall <S%H7200>see<s%> his <S%H6440>face<s%> with <S%H8643>joy<s%>: for he will <S%H7725>render<s%> unto <S%H582>man<s%> his <S%H6666>righteousness<s%>.

He <S%H7789>looketh<s%> upon <S%H582>men<s%>, and if any <S%H559>say<s%>, I have <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, and <S%H5753>perverted<s%> that which was <S%H3477>right<s%>, and it <S%H7737>profited<s%> me not; He: or, He shall look upon men, and say

He will <S%H6299>deliver<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> from <S%H5674>going<s%> into the <S%H7845>pit<s%>, and his <S%H2416>life<s%> shall <S%H7200>see<s%> the <S%H216>light<s%>. He: or, He hath delivered my soul, etc, and my life
Lo, all these things <S%H6466>worketh<s%> <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H6471>oftentimes<s%> <S%H7969><s%> with <S%H1397>man<s%>, oftentimes: Heb. twice and thrice
To bring <S%H7725>back<s%> his <S%H5315>soul<s%> from the <S%H7845>pit<s%>, to be <S%H215>enlightened<s%> with the <S%H216>light<s%> of the <S%H2416>living<s%>.
Mark <S%H7181>well<s%>, O <S%H347>Job<s%>, <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto me: hold thy <S%H2790>peace<s%>, and I will <S%H1696>speak<s%>.
If thou <S%H3426>hast<s%> any thing to <S%H4405>say<s%>, <S%H7725>answer<s%> me: <S%H1696>speak<s%>, for I <S%H2654>desire<s%> to <S%H6663>justify<s%> thee.
If not, <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto me: hold thy <S%H2790>peace<s%>, and I shall <S%H502>teach<s%> thee <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>.
